discussion.content: Correct - from: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/app-service/overview-authentication-authorization > "...authorization (providing access to secure data)..."

Authentication - done first, will verify user credentials. 
Authorization - done second, will verify if the user action is permissible based on his roles/permissions

It's correct. Pattern of connection : 
Authentification → Roles attributed → Authorization in function of the permission of the roles
legitimacy of user is checked first (Authentication) later the permissions/ roles are checked to give him Authorization to work on resources.
authorisation to check a user's eligibility to use a resource

authN - you are the same person you are saying you are as defined in the identity provider of the system
authZ - what you are allowed to do inside the system

discussion.content:
Answer: Integrity

Integrity refers to keeping data or messages correct. You want to be sure that the data you retrieve is the same as the data you stored. Integrity is about having confidence that data hasn't been tampered with or altered. It is the 'I' in 'CIA' (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability)
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/describe-security-concepts-methodologies/3-describe-defense-depth
Correct: ensuring DATA is not altered....."Integrity"

assessments - Compliance Manager assessments help your organization evaluate its compliance with industry and regional regulations. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/compliance/compliance-manager-assessments

discussion.content: There seem to be more answers wrong than correct – this is annoying – I doubt the paid value of this service
NYY, Data / Info is the organizations responsibility.
It should be No Yes Yes since Information and Data always organisation's responsibilities not cloud providers

comments.content: You're saying is NNY... but the logic you outlined indicates the answer NYY..for IaaS the cloud service provider is responsible for the network. My vote is NYY

discussion.content:
I vote NNY

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/fundamentals/shared-responsibility

1. SaaS = Software as a Service, you consume the hosted application from Microsoft. The updates are the responisibility of the hoster.
2. IaaS = Infrastructure as a Service, the Cloud hoster is responsible for Physical hosts, Physical network and Physical datacenter.
3. For all cloud deployment types, you own your data and identities. You are responsible for protecting the security of your data and identities, on-premises resources, and the cloud components you control (which varies by service type).

From the SC-900 course from Microsoft:
Responsibilities always retained by the customer organization include:
• Information and data
• Devices (mobile and PCs)
• Accounts and identities
the given answer is correct NYY
Perhaps the wrong answers are intentional to spark the discussion.
